items.name: 大鹏所城
items.description:
大鹏所城，全称为"大鹏守御千户所城"，位于广东省深圳市大鹏新区鹏城社区，是明清两代中国海防的军事要塞，有"沿海所城，大鹏为最"之称，是鸦片战争肇始地，有明清的海防历史和滨海客家文化氛围。深圳又别称"鹏城"，即源于此，被誉为"鹏城之根"。大鹏所城文化根脉深厚，聚集了来自天南地北的兵将，融合了客家文化、疍家文化、广府文化和海防文化，诞生了深圳最早的移民文化。
 大鹏所城建于明洪武二十七年（1394年），即海防卫所，所城平面呈近梯形布局，占地约10万平方米，城墙高6米、长1200米，上设雉堞654个，并辟有马道。全城分东、西、南、北四个城门（北门于明万历年间被堵塞），每个城门上建有一座敌楼，两边各设两个警铺。城外东、西、南三面，环绕着一条长1200米、宽5米、深3米的护城濠。城内现存清广东水师提督赖恩爵的振威将军第、清福建水师提督刘起龙的将军第等十余座清代府第式建筑，以及侯王庙、天后宫、赵公祠等古迹。
 自明初建城以来，大鹏所城一直担负着深港地区的海防安全，多次抵御和抗击了葡萄牙、倭寇和英国殖民主义者的入侵，是明清时期反抗外侮、捍卫主权的主要海防堡垒之一，是我国目前保存较为完整的明清海防军事城堡之一。2001年6月25日，大鹏所城被中华人民共和国国务院公布为第五批全国重点文物保护单位，成为深圳市首个全国重点文物保护单位。2024年6月15日，南门城墙发生小范围坍塌，现已设立安全围挡并组织专家进行全面评估。
items.descriptionEn: A well-preserved Ming and Qing coastal defense fortress, known as 'the best among coastal defense cities'. It is Shenzhen's only national cultural relic protection unit, built in 1394 during the 27th year of the Hongwu reign of the Ming Dynasty. It has a history of more than 600 years of resisting foreign aggression, producing outstanding national heroes such as Lai Enjue, Liu Qilong, and Liu Heizai.
items.history:
清初大鹏所原设防守千总一员，兵三百名。
顺治十三年（1656年），历史城墙新安县知县傅尔植奏请改设大鹏所防守营，官兵五百名。
康熙七年（1668年），并大鹏所防守营入惠州协，归惠州协副将管辖，时该营官兵凡四百员名。
康熙四十三年（1704年），改大鹏所防守营为大鹏水师营，官兵九百三十一名。防所大炮共一百六十八位。
雍正四年（1726年），裁游击，改设参将一员，添设外委千把总七员，改隶广东水陆提标统辖。
嘉庆十五年（1810年），水陆区分，广东增设水师提督，驻虎门，设五营，大鹏为外海水师营，设参将一员，兵额八百名。
道光十一年（1831年），以该营所辖之洋面宽广，难于防卫，遂分设左右二营。左营即原大鹏营，兵额五百零五名，右营驻东涌所城，兵四百八十二名。
道光二十年（1840年），以鸦片走私盛行及英人威胁日大，遂将大鹏营提升为协，增设副将一员，移驻九龙。
咸丰十年（1860年），九龙地区转归英属，大鹏协所辖部分台汛位英界内，故被废置。
同治八年（1869年），该协左营实存兵四百三十名，右营实存兵三百二十名。
光绪二十四年（1898年），英人租界新界及离岛地区，该协所辖汛台内全位英界内，故亦被裁设。
光绪二十五年（1899年），九龙寨城内之清朝官兵被英军驱逐，该协两营故亦被裁。
2024年6月15日16时许，深圳市大鹏所城南门城墙发生小范围坍塌。大鹏新区应急、文体、街道办事处等部门已第一时间赶赴现场处置。坍塌区域周围已设立安全围挡，并正组织应急、文物等领域专家对坍塌情况进行全面评估。
items.historyEn:
In the early Qing Dynasty, Dapeng Fortress originally had a defense officer and 300 soldiers.
In the 13th year of Shunzhi (1656), Fu Erzhi, the county magistrate of Xin'an County, requested to change the fortress to a defense camp with 500 officers and soldiers.
In the 7th year of Kangxi (1668), the Dapeng Defense Camp was merged into the Huizhou Battalion, under the jurisdiction of the Huizhou Battalion deputy general, with 400 officers and soldiers.
In the 43rd year of Kangxi (1704), the Dapeng Defense Camp was changed to the Dapeng Naval Camp, with 931 officers and soldiers and 168 cannons.
In the 4th year of Yongzheng (1726), the position of guerrilla was abolished, and a colonel was appointed, with 7 additional junior officers, under the jurisdiction of the Guangdong Land and Water Command.
In the 15th year of Jiaqing (1810), land and water forces were separated, and a naval commander was added in Guangdong, stationed in Humen, with five camps, including Dapeng as an outer sea naval camp, with a colonel and 800 soldiers.
In the 11th year of Daoguang (1831), due to the vast sea area under its jurisdiction being difficult to defend, it was divided into left and right camps. The left camp was the original Dapeng Camp with 505 soldiers, and the right camp was stationed in Dongchong Fortress with 482 soldiers.
In the 20th year of Daoguang (1840), due to the prevalence of opium smuggling and the increasing threat from the British, the Dapeng Camp was upgraded to a brigade, with an additional deputy general stationed in Kowloon.
In the 10th year of Xianfeng (1860), the Kowloon area was transferred to British rule, and some of the Dapeng Brigade's stations were within British territory, so they were abandoned.
In the 8th year of Tongzhi (1869), the left camp had 430 soldiers and the right camp had 320 soldiers.
In the 24th year of Guangxu (1898), the British leased the New Territories and outlying islands, and all the stations of the brigade were within British territory, so it was also abolished.
In the 25th year of Guangxu (1899), the Qing soldiers in Kowloon Walled City were expelled by the British, so both camps of the brigade were also abolished.
At about 16:00 on June 15, 2024, a small-scale collapse occurred on the south gate wall of Dapeng Fortress in Shenzhen. Emergency, cultural, and street office departments of Dapeng New District rushed to the scene immediately for disposal. Safety fences have been set up around the collapse area, and emergency and cultural relic experts are being organized to conduct a comprehensive assessment of the collapse situation.
items.architecture: 据清代《新安县志》记载，大鹏所城为广州左卫千户张斌开筑，内外砌以砖石，沿海所城，大鹏为最，周围三百二十五丈，高一丈八尺，面广六尺，址广一丈四尺，门楼四，敌楼如之，警铺一十六，雉堞六百五十四。所城平面呈近梯形布局，占地约10万平方米，城墙高6米、长1200米，上设雉堞654个，并辟有马道。全城分东、西、南、北四个城门（北门于明万历年间被堵塞），每个城门上建有一座敌楼，两边各设两个警铺。城外东、西、南三面，环绕着一条长1200米、宽5米、深3米的护城濠。
items.architectureEn: According to the Qing Dynasty 'Records of Xin'an County', Dapeng Fortress was built by Zhang Bin, a thousand household of the Guangzhou Left Guard, with bricks and stones inside and outside. Among coastal fortresses, Dapeng is the best, with a circumference of 325 zhang, a height of 1.8 zhang, a width of 6 chi at the top, and a width of 1.4 zhang at the base. It has 4 gate towers, 4 watchtowers, 16 sentry posts, and 654 battlements. The fortress has a nearly trapezoidal layout, covering an area of about 100,000 square meters, with a wall height of 6 meters and a length of 1,200 meters, with 654 battlements and a horse path. The city has four gates in the east, west, south, and north (the north gate was blocked during the Wanli period of the Ming Dynasty), with a watchtower on each gate and two sentry posts on each side. The east, west, and south sides of the city are surrounded by a moat 1,200 meters long, 5 meters wide, and 3 meters deep.
items.research: 大鹏所城主要格局、街道及建筑保存相当完整。体现城外观的部分城墙及东、南两城门保存完好，城内现存有赵公祠、天后庙、华光庙、候王庙和十余座清代将军府第以及一批清代民居，其中尤以赖恩爵的"振威将军第"保存最为完整和突出，对研究中国古代建筑史、城镇规划建设史、明清民俗文化及岭南地区古建筑发展史等均具有重要的价值。
items.researchEn: The main layout, streets, and buildings of Dapeng Fortress are well preserved. Some of the outer walls and the east and south gates are well preserved. Inside the city, there are Zhao Gong Temple, Tianhou Temple, Huaguang Temple, Houwang Temple, more than ten Qing Dynasty general's mansions, and a number of Qing Dynasty dwellings, among which Lai Enjue's 'Zhenwei General's Mansion' is the most complete and prominent. It has important value for the study of Chinese ancient architectural history, urban planning and construction history, Ming and Qing folk culture, and the development history of ancient buildings in Lingnan area.
items.culture:
大鹏所城，全称为"大鹏守御千户所城"，为明清两代中国海防的军事要塞，有"沿海所城，大鹏为最"之称。大鹏所城文化根脉深厚，聚集了来自天南地北的兵将，融合了客家文化、疍家文化、广府文化和海防文化，诞生了深圳最早的移民文化。大鹏所城历经600多年风雨，仍完好地保留着旧时的古庙、古城楼、古民居、古宅院、古街道、古粮仓等古代建筑遗址。如今，大鹏所城已成为一个重要的旅游胜地和文化遗产，是国内现存最完好的明清海防卫所遗存之一。
大鹏所城是深圳"鹏城"别名的源头与根脉，也是明代为了抗击倭寇而设立的"大鹏守御千户所城"，在明清两代是南中国海防军事要塞，因抗击英军而名动天下。历经600多年风雨的海防所城，有久远的历史和文化。明代大鹏所城有武略将军刘钟、徐勋，清代大鹏所城有赖氏"三代五将"、刘氏"父子将军"等明清两代十几个将军，为大鹏所城赢得了"将军村"的荣誉。清代的大鹏所城及守城的赖恩爵将军取得了鸦片战争首战——九龙海战的胜利，载入中国近代史册。
items.cultureEn:
Dapeng Fortress, full name "Dapeng Defense Thousand Household Fortress", was a military fortress for coastal defense in China during the Ming and Qing dynasties, known as "among coastal fortresses, Dapeng is the best". Dapeng Fortress has a profound cultural heritage, gathering soldiers from all over the country, integrating Hakka culture, Tanka culture, Cantonese culture, and coastal defense culture, giving birth to Shenzhen's earliest immigrant culture. After more than 600 years of wind and rain, Dapeng Fortress still well preserves ancient temples, ancient city gates, ancient dwellings, ancient mansions, ancient streets, ancient granaries, and other ancient architectural sites. Today, Dapeng Fortress has become an important tourist attraction and cultural heritage, and is one of the best-preserved Ming and Qing coastal defense fortress remains in China.
Dapeng Fortress is the source and root of Shenzhen's alias "Pengcheng", and it was also the "Dapeng Defense Thousand Household Fortress" established in the Ming Dynasty to resist Japanese pirates. It was a military fortress for coastal defense in southern China during the Ming and Qing dynasties, and became famous for resisting the British army. After more than 600 years of wind and rain, the coastal defense fortress has a long history and culture. In the Ming Dynasty, Dapeng Fortress had military generals Liu Zhong and Xu Xun. In the Qing Dynasty, Dapeng Fortress had more than ten generals, including the Lai family's "three generations and five generals" and the Liu family's "father-son generals", earning Dapeng Fortress the honor of "General Village". In the Qing Dynasty, Dapeng Fortress and General Lai Enjue, who defended the city, won the first battle of the Opium War - the Battle of Kowloon, which was recorded in modern Chinese history.

title.zh: 大鹏所城 - 深圳文化遗产
title.en: Dapeng Ancient City - Shenzhen Cultural Heritage

description.zh: 明代海防要塞，保存完好的明清海防体系，被誉为'沿海所城，大鹏为最'
description.en: Dapeng Ancient City is Shenzhen's only national cultural relic protection unit, built in 1394 during the Ming Dynasty, with over 600 years of history in coastal defense.

items.name: 南头古城
items.description: 深圳历史最悠久的古城，见证了深圳从汉代到现代的历史变迁。南头古城又称新安故城，建于明洪武二十七年（1394年），是明清时期广东海防的重要军事基地，也是深圳历史文化的重要发源地。
items.descriptionEn: Shenzhen's oldest ancient city, witnessing Shenzhen's historical changes from the Han Dynasty to modern times. Also known as Xin'an Ancient City, it was built in 1394 during the Ming Dynasty, serving as an important military base for coastal defense in Guangdong during the Ming and Qing dynasties, and is also an important birthplace of Shenzhen's historical culture.

title.zh: 南头古城 - 深圳文化遗产
title.en: Nantou Ancient City - Shenzhen Cultural Heritage

description.zh: 南头古城是深圳历史最悠久的古城，见证了深圳从汉代到现代的历史变迁。
description.en: Nantou Ancient City is Shenzhen's oldest ancient city, witnessing Shenzhen's historical changes from the Han Dynasty to modern times.

items.name: 鹤湖新居
items.description: 深圳保存最完整、规模最大的客家围屋建筑群，被誉为'客家围屋博物馆'。鹤湖新居建于清嘉庆二十二年（1817年），是深圳地区保存最完整、规模最大的客家围屋建筑群，占地面积约25000平方米，建筑面积约14530平方米，共有179间房。
items.descriptionEn: The most complete and largest preserved Hakka enclosed house complex in Shenzhen, known as the 'Hakka Enclosed House Museum'. Built in 1817 during the Qing Dynasty, it covers an area of about 25,000 square meters with a construction area of about 14,530 square meters, containing 179 rooms.

title.zh: 鹤湖新居 - 深圳文化遗产

description.zh: 鹤湖新居是深圳保存最完整、规模最大的客家围屋建筑群，被誉为'客家围屋博物馆'。
description.en: Hehu Xingu is the most complete and largest preserved Hakka enclosed house complex in Shenzhen, known as the 'Hakka Enclosed House Museum'.

items.name: 咸头岭遗址
items.description: 深圳最早的史前文化遗址，距今约7000年，展现了珠三角地区早期人类文明。咸头岭遗址是一处新石器时代中期至晚期的贝丘遗址，位于深圳市大鹏新区南澳街道，总面积约30000平方米，出土了大量陶器、石器、玉器等文物，为研究珠三角地区早期人类文明提供了重要资料。
items.descriptionEn: Shenzhen's earliest prehistoric cultural site, dating back about 7000 years, showing early human civilization in the Pearl River Delta region. Xiantouling Site is a shell mound site from the mid to late Neolithic period, located in Nan'ao Street, Dapeng New District, Shenzhen, covering an area of about 30,000 square meters. A large number of pottery, stone tools, jade articles and other cultural relics were unearthed, providing important materials for studying early human civilization in the Pearl River Delta region.

title.zh: 咸头岭遗址 - 深圳文化遗产

description.zh: 深圳最早的史前文化遗址，距今约7000年，展现了珠三角地区早期人类文明。
description.en: Shenzhen's earliest prehistoric cultural site, dating back about 7000 years, showing early human civilization in the Pearl River Delta region.

items.name: 文天祥纪念馆
items.description: 纪念南宋民族英雄文天祥的纪念馆，展示其生平事迹和崇高精神。文天祥纪念馆位于深圳市南山区，建筑面积约1200平方米，分为生平事迹、文学成就、后世影响三个部分，通过文物、图片、文字等多种形式，全面展示了文天祥的生平事迹和崇高精神。
items.descriptionEn: Memorial hall commemorating Wen Tianxiang, a national hero of the Southern Song Dynasty, showcasing his life story and noble spirit. Located in Nanshan District, Shenzhen, with a construction area of about 1,200 square meters, it is divided into three parts: life story, literary achievements, and influence. Through cultural relics, pictures, texts and other forms, it comprehensively displays Wen Tianxiang's life story and noble spirit.

title.zh: 文天祥纪念馆 - 深圳文化遗产
title.en: Wen Tianxiang Memorial Hall - Shenzhen Cultural Heritage

description.zh: 纪念南宋民族英雄文天祥的纪念馆，展示其生平事迹和崇高精神。
description.en: Memorial hall commemorating Wen Tianxiang, a national hero of the Southern Song Dynasty, showcasing his life story and noble spirit.

items.name: 大万世居
items.description: 深圳第二大客家围屋，保存完好的清代客家建筑群。大万世居建于清乾隆五十六年（1791年），是深圳地区保存完好的清代客家建筑群，占地面积约15000平方米，建筑面积约12000平方米，共有144间房。
items.descriptionEn: Shenzhen's second largest Hakka enclosed house, well-preserved Qing Dynasty Hakka architectural complex. Built in 1791 during the Qing Dynasty, it is a well-preserved Qing Dynasty Hakka architectural complex in Shenzhen, covering an area of about 15,000 square meters with a construction area of about 12,000 square meters, containing 144 rooms.

title.zh: 大万世居 - 深圳文化遗产

description.zh: 深圳第二大客家围屋，保存完好的清代客家建筑群。
description.en: Shenzhen's second largest Hakka enclosed house, well-preserved Qing Dynasty Hakka architectural complex.
